Description: Papyrus. Early demotic letter. There are seven lines of text on the recto, plus the traces of an eighth line separated from the main text and in smaller handwriting. The papyrus is torn at both top and bottom, but the margins are preserved (2 cm top; 4 cm bottom, as measured from line 7). The right-hand side is also torn, but the left-hand side looks at though it is cut, with the writing in some lines running right up to the edge. On the verso, written upside down to the text on the recto, is the end of a one-line address.
Curator's comments: Under study by Naglaa Ezzeldeen (Helwan University, Cairo).

The beginning of the first line, with the name of the addressor, is lost (the first preserved part of the letter reads, 'O, may Pre cause his lifetime to be long'). Only the final signs of the name of the addressee's father are still visible, but the name can be found in the address on the verso, Horkheb (son of) Ankhemhat. A signficant part of the letter has been lost and its contents are unclear, but very large quantities of something (1,523) are referred to and a number of people are mentioned by name.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (380991) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/380991)
